term.title: recrystallization

item.text: (chemical): The repeated dissolution and precipitation of a solid from a liquid solvent.

(metallurgical): The process in which a crystalline solid with a high degree of disorder develops a new microstructure by the nucleation of relatively imperfection-free regions, and their propagation throughout the complete solid.
